body_html: Update: the underlying cause of this bug is that LocalCLIDebugWrapper attempts to intercept OpErrors that happen during the underlying tf.Session.run() calls. It works if the OpError happens in the middle of a graph execution, which will generate the debug dump directory. But in this case, the OpError (due to invalid device name) happens before the graph execution even happens, so there is no debug dump directory and LocalCLIDebugWrapper generates an error message that masks the original exception. I will push a fix to this issue soon.

body: Update: the underlying cause of this bug is that `LocalCLIDebugWrapper` attempts to intercept `OpError`s that happen during the underlying `tf.Session.run()` calls. It works if the `OpError` happens in the middle of a graph execution, which will generate the debug dump directory. But in this case, the `OpError` (due to invalid device name) happens before the graph execution even happens, so there is no debug dump directory and `LocalCLIDebugWrapper` generates an error message that masks the original exception. I will push a fix to this issue soon.
